clue_J_6_1.clue_html: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from Arthur Bryant's Barbeque in Kansas City, MO.) Kansas City barbeque sauce is typically sweet & tangy: sweet from brown sugar &/or molasses, & tangy from this, usually the cider or white type
clue_J_6_1.clue_text: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from Arthur Bryant's Barbeque in Kansas City, MO.)  Kansas City barbeque sauce is typically sweet & tangy: sweet from brown sugar &/or molasses, & tangy from this, usually the cider or white type

clue_J_6_2.clue_html: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from Arthur Bryant's Barbeque in Kansas City, MO.) Some people call them racks, but Arthur Bryant's serves their ribs in these thick, meaty units
clue_J_6_2.clue_text: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from Arthur Bryant's Barbeque in Kansas City, MO.)  Some people call them racks, but Arthur Bryant's serves their ribs in these thick, meaty units

clue_J_6_3.clue_html: (Kelly of the Clue Crew presents from Arthur Bryant's Barbeque in Kansas City, MO.) Containing a mixture of herbs & spices including salt, garlic & paprika, it's the two-word term for what goes on the ribs first
clue_J_6_3.clue_text: (Kelly of the Clue Crew presents from Arthur Bryant's Barbeque in Kansas City, MO.)  Containing a mixture of herbs & spices including salt, garlic & paprika, it's the two-word term for what goes on the ribs first

clue_J_6_4.clue_html: (Kelly of the Clue Crew presents from Arthur Bryant's Barbeque in Kansas City, MO.) Contributing to the meat's flavor is the type of wood used in the smoker; here, it's a combination of oak & this common hardwood, popular for traditional barbeque flavor

clue_J_6_5.clue_html: (Jimmy of the Clue Crew presents from Arthur Bryant's Barbeque in Kansas City, MO.) They sound overdone & like something that might be discarded, but a specialty of Kansas City barbeque are these crusty cubes of brisket
